result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Nmi Aldaco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report to the probation and parole office within 2 business days of release from jail if not previously contacted by a Probation agent.
Concurrent with: Probation in 14CM198, counts1&4 and 15CM15 are to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

The defendant shall have no contact with Dean Hainz, Raymond Torres, or Lane Polzin  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless specifically approved by the the parties and the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Christine Kuczynski agreement reached on both cases

Pre-trial conference on January 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 11:20 am.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Jose Nmi Aldaco, appeared via video from Clark Co Jail, with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in court.  Special Appearance by Attorney Kuczynski  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 11:20 am.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT
